en.title: ЁЯЪ░ Potabl. - The Water Quality Analysis Tool
en.description: Enter the values for the parameters below to check if the water is safe to drink (according to WHO/BIS standards).
en.potable: тЬЕ The water is POTABLE based on your inputs.
en.not_potable: тЭМ The water is NOT POTABLE.
en.violations_header: **The following parameters are out of safe limits:**
en.tip: ЁЯТб Tip: Consider treatment methods like filtration, RO, pH adjustment, etc.
en.home_title: Welcome to the Water Quality Analysis Tool!
en.basic_safe: The basic parameters meet WHO/BIS requirements.
en.missing_optional: However, some optional parameters are missing.
en.recommend_testing: To ensure accurate assessment of potability, it's recommended to test these parameters:
en.awareness_title: ЁЯТз The Critical Need for Water Quality Analysis and Public Awareness
en.awareness_intro: Water is one of the most essential elements for life on Earth. It sustains human health, supports agriculture and industry, and maintains ecological balance. Yet, despite its fundamental importance, access to clean and safe drinking water remains a serious global challenge. Contaminated water is a leading cause of disease and death, particularly in low-income and underserved communities. In this context, the need for **water quality analysis** and **public awareness** becomes not only a technical concern but a vital public health and social justice issue.
en.why_clean_content: Safe drinking water is critical to human well-being. We depend on it for hydration, food preparation, sanitation, and countless other daily needs. However, when water is contaminatedтАФwhether by biological agents like bacteria and viruses, or chemical pollutants such as nitrates and heavy metalsтАФit becomes a source of harm rather than health. Poor water quality has been linked to a wide range of illnesses, including diarrhea, cholera, hepatitis, and even chronic conditions like cancer and neurological disorders. However, many people do not have proper access to clean water and resort to natural water body sources like rivers and ponds. These waters might be contamindated and can have physical, chemical and biological substances that would be harmful for human consumption. Boiling the water can only do so much for purifying but it does not make the water completely safe for consumption.
en.global_crisis_header: ЁЯМН The Global Clean Water Crisis
en.global_crisis_content: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), over 2 billion people globally consume water that contains fecal matter. Contaminated water contributes to more than half a million deaths annually from diarrheal diseases alone. These statistics are not just numbersтАФthey represent lives lost, livelihoods threatened, and futures compromised. From children to elders, these diseases have no restraints to age and gender.
en.analysis_header: ЁЯФм The Role of Water Quality Analysis
en.analysis_content: Testing and monitoring the quality of water is the first step toward ensuring its safety. Water quality analysis helps identify harmful substances, trace pollution sources, and inform the treatment methods required to make water safe. Whether in rural hand pumps, urban slums, or institutional settings, regular testing can prevent outbreaks and build public trust in water infrastructure. Moreover, it provides critical data for policymakers and public health officials, allowing them to take timely preventive action and allocate resources more effectively. As climate change and industrial growth continue to strain natural water sources, systematic water testing becomes even more vital in maintaining public health, ecosystem balance, and sustainable development.
en.awareness_content: Despite the risks, a large portion of the population is unaware of what makes water safe or dangerous. Many people do not know how to test their water, how to purify it effectively, or even that water can appear clean while containing invisible contaminants. This is where awareness campaigns, public education programs, and community-led initiatives play a crucial role. The more we speak about these issues, the more awareness we spread to people. Many schools and NGOs have started spreading awareness through campaigns in rural areas as well as urban areas. It is important that we provide our future generation with crucial knowledge about the quality parameters of water.
en.environmental_header: ЁЯМ▒ Environmental Impact of Water Pollution
en.environmental_content: Contaminated water can devastate ecosystems, killing fish, damaging coral reefs, and polluting the soil. When industrial or agricultural pollutants enter rivers and lakes, the consequences ripple through entire food chains. Unclean water sources also have biological wastes and contaminants that make it unsuitable for human consumption or regular use. This leads to sickness and can also be fatal if the water is not treated before consumption.
en.policy_header: ЁЯУЬ Policy and the Path Forward
en.policy_content: Many countries have established drinking water standards based on WHO or BIS guidelines, but enforcement is inconsistent. Governments must invest in infrastructure, while citizens must stay informed and advocate for clean water as a basic right. It is necessary that everyone, irrespective of their age or geographic location, is educated about the importance of clean water and also advocate for the supply of clean water in underdeveloped areas around the world.
en.conclusion_content: Clean water is not a luxuryтАФit is a necessity. Water quality analysis and public awareness are the twin pillars of a healthy and equitable society. Whether through a government-backed testing program, or a classroom science project,  every step toward understanding and improving water quality is a step toward a better future.
en.contact: Contact your Local Panchayat or Corporation to report any variations in water quality
en.basic_meets_standards: тЬЕ The basic parameters meet WHO/BIS requirements.
en.missing_params_warning: тЪая╕П However, some optional parameters are missing. To ensure accurate assessment of potability, it's recommended to test these parameters:
en.high_confidence: тЬЕ High confidence in potability result.
en.moderate_confidence: тЪая╕П Moderate confidence. Consider testing missing/advanced parameters.
en.low_confidence: тЭЧLow confidence. Too many parameters missing or outside safe range.
